seriesJson.title: How's the family
seriesJson.description: Drama with comment, designed to show in an entertaining way how important the family is to the people in it.

node.title: The family is here to stay
node.description: This final episode in the series is a  summary of ideas broached in the various programs.  A roundtable discussion with four of the academic advisers for the series is the core of this program.

node.title: 48 hours in a day
node.description: The changing form of the family and some common disrupting influences.

node.title: Home: Route 1 or 79th Street
node.description: This program dramatizes family life and rural-urban migration.

node.title: Life without father
node.description: This program dramatizes the challenges that divorce presents to parents and their children.

node.title: Adolescent fancy
node.description: Two wise parents endure but limit the unpredictabilites of their adolescent son.

node.title: Adolescents on the loose
node.description: A story showing that problematic adolescents can be created by unthinking parents.

node.title: Square pegs in round holes
node.description: The struggle of a boy against his father's pressure in the choice of a vocation.

node.title: What will people think?
node.description: A portrayal of extremes in attention and indifference to public opinion about home habits.

node.title: School behind the home
node.description: Parent-teacher relationships, with the child as interpreter and misinterpreter of what happens at school.

node.title: Out in the cold
node.description: The new baby causes a child's resentment.
